content.description: Stand start to the right of Stowaway on a blank looking face with alright crimps. Work up the face to the top, trending right towards the very top.
content.location: Stand starts to the right of Stowaway on thin face crimps and climbs straight up.

content.description: This is a great warm-up on an otherwise difficult boulder. Solid holds, big flat edges, and it's not a highball! Sit start on a good edge and work up the edges to top out on a good jug.
content.location: Sit starts on the left-hand side of the Ship's Prow overhang, closest to The Lighthouse and Shipwreck.

content.description: Skip all of the hard moves in the beginning, including the dyno. Start right off of the jug on the right-hand side and make the move to the two crimps with the right feet. Top out from there.
content.location: Stand starts off of the slab on the good jug higher up on Pirate Bay. Goes straight up from the jug.

content.description: If you're feeling like walking the plank today, this one's for you! Take a leap of faith, literally. Stand start as for Blackbeard. Work up the prow using holds on the left used for Blackbeard and a pinch on the right-hand side. From there, get good feet and dyno right to a jug on the right side. That is the crux. From the jug, go straight up to two tiny crimps, one for your left hand, and one for your right. The correct feet here make the holds good. From those, slap to the top, the lip is good. Pad this one right, you don't want to take a digger into the neighboring slab.Video:Â Pirate Bay
content.location: Stand starts as for Blackbeard but instead of staying on the left-hand side, Pirate Bay makes the transition to the right-hand side of the "prow" to top out.

content.description: Stand start on the "prow" of the Ship on decent holds. Work up the left side of the prow to the top.
content.location: Stand starts to the right of Verichoss on the "prow" of the ship. Works up the left side next to Verichoss.
